description: Late Iron Age settlement followed by an enclosed farm which developed into a villa building. A structure to the south was identified as a possible temple, it was demolished in the late 2nd CE.
bibliography: Booth, and Lawrence. “The Iron Age Settlement and Roman Villa at Thurnham, Kent,” 2006. https://doi.org/10.5284/1008824.
Martyn, Blick, Brindle, and et al. “Thurnham (Kent).” The Rural Settlement of Roman Britain: an online resource, 2015. https://doi.org/10.5284/1030449.
